title.narrative: Macroeconomic Emergency Programme to Protect Economic and Social Progress
N/A
N/A
Programa Macroeconómico de Emergencia para Proteger el Avance Económico y Social

description.narrative: El objetivo del programa es apoyar la acción del gobierno para (i) restablecer la estabilidad macroeconómica; (ii) tomar medidas deajuste fiscal para fomentar un equilibrio fiscal sostenible a corto y a mediano plazo; y (iii) proteger el gasto social para salvaguardarlos avances sociales realizados. La estructura y el contenido del programa concuerdan con el Servicio Ampliado del FMI (SAF), quefue aprobado recientemente.El programa está estructurado como préstamo de financiamiento especial para el desarrollo con una sola operación que sedesembolsará en un solo tramo

The objective of the programme is to support the government's efforts to:(i) regain macroeconomic stability; (ii) implement fiscal adjustment measures that foster a sustainable fiscal balance in the short and medium term; and (iii) protect social spending to safeguard social gains achieved. The structure and content of the programme are aligned to the recently approved International Monetary Fund (IMF)Extended Fund Facility (EFF).The programme is structured as a Special Developing Lending with a single operation that will disburse in a single tranche.
Commitment in fourth quarter of 2018
Disbursement in fourth quarter of 2018
Interest repayment in fourth quarter of 2019
Interest repayment in fourth quarter of 2020
Interest repayment in fourth quarter of 2021
Interest repayment in second quarter of 2019
Interest repayment in second quarter of 2020
Interest repayment in second quarter of 2021
Loan repayment in fourth quarter of 2021

title.narrative: 1. Exchange offer for debt restructuring of stock of central government domestic debt held by private creditors and eligible for debt restructuring (consistent with the IDB and IMF program) launched.

title.narrative: 2. The Government of Barbados introduces a new Garbage and Sewage Contribution (GSC) to be levied through Barbados Water Authority bills implemented.

description.narrative: 2. The Government of Barbados introduces a new Garbage and Sewage Contribution (GSC) to be levied through Barbados Water Authority bills implemented.

title.narrative: 3. Draft of revised Financial Management and Audit (FMA) Act proposal to establish a permanent and binding budget calendar (envisaging budget approval prior to fiscal year) submitted to Bank.

title.narrative: 4. Revised FMA submitted by the MoFEI to Parliament includes a section on SOE which grants more autonomy to the MoFEI to oversee SOE, including the approval process of all borrowings and assumptions of other liabilities undertaken by SOE

title.narrative: 1. The Government of Barbados commits to a floor for social protection spending on five (5) key programs and to a floor for Welfare Department spending including cash transfers and assistance for house rents, utilities, food, and education to the poor and vulnerable population.
